column5: During my NW Ontario trips I like to freeze a mess of jumbo perch fillets to bring home. After more than thirty years, and my manic pursuits of walleyes having tempered to a bit lower frenzy more matching to my age, it occurs to me that it may be fun to fish for perch with my flyrod. Anyone do that? What do you use? I'm thinking Clouser minnows in colors to mimic shiner minnows. Maybe a black leech fly.Anyone have suggestions?
Those would both work, I use a wooly bugger with a bead head. Any sinking panfish fly should work just fine.
A 6wt, 200 grain SA Streamer Express, and small clousers. #s 8 -10
